channel.title: The Revealer
channel.description: a review of religion and media

item.title: When-Veterans-Day-was-Armistice-Day-1918-14
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Nov. 11, 1952: Brother Scott, 4, and Billy, 2, Morris hold their flags and stand at attention as marines from El Toro pass in Armistice Day parade in Long Beach. The boys' father was in Korea.

item.title: rtx159py
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: U.S. Army soldiers and others carry a giant American flag during the New York City Veterans Day parade on Fifth Avenue in New York, November 11, 2013. MIKE SEGA/REUTERS

item.title: clergy-Selma-Charlotesville
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Image: Ecumenical and interfaith clergy activists gathered at Selma, Alabama (1965) and Charlottesville, Virginia (2017). Details of photographs by Matt Heron (above) and Jordy Yager (below)
